Description: Rim fragment of Attic black-figured pottery dinos. On the top, palmette and lotus frieze; added red for the cuff of the lotus, the heart, the central petal and alternate fronds of the palmette and the lines framing the ornament; also on the interior and exterior of the rim. Two repair holes, one at the left exterior edge of the rim, one at the right. The underside of the rim glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'For the unusual pointed central petal of the palmette, compare an unattributed dinos, Vatican 16594 (W. Helbig, Führer durch die öffentlichen Sammlung klassischer Altertümer in Rom [4th ed. supervised by H. Speier; Tübingen, 1963], vol. 1: 644 no. 884 [Sichtermann]; C. Albizzati, Vasi Dipinti del Vaticano [Rome, 1924] no. 306, pl. 29).' Such palmettes are specifically Attic.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 79 no. 264 pl. 60)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1190)
